title: Protein extraction from aortas or VSMCs for Western blot
original description: This protocol describes protein extraction steps from mouse aorta or vascular smooth muscle cell sample for Western blot. The lysis buffer use is a SMAD lysys buffer adopted from Beaufort et al (2014).
steps:
Sample preparation
1. Thaw frozen aorta in a 37°C waterbath, mince on ice, and pool aortas from 3-4 mice in a single microtube.
For VMSCs, wash cells with phosphate-buffered saline (PBS) three times, aspirate the PBS thoroughly.

Lysis buffer
2. Prepare SMAD lysis buffer: 
10 mM Tris-HCl pH 7.6,
1% Triton X-100,
100 mM NaCl,
2 mM EDTA,
10% v/v glycerol
containing 50 mM NaF,
20 mM Na4P207,
2 mM Na3VO4,
and 1x protease inhibitor cocktail (Nacalai Tesque)

Protein extraction
3. Lyse pooled minced aortas or VSMCs in 100 or 150 μl lysis buffer for each microtube (around 30 mg tissue) or 35 mm dish, respectively.
4. Use a homogenizer (for aortas) followed by a sonicator to further lyse the tissue.
Use a sonicator to process VSMC samples.
5. Centrifuge 15,000 x g for 10 min at 4°C.
4temperature 
600s
6. Transfer supernatant into a new microtube.

Measurement of protein concentration
7. Measure protein concentration by using Pierce 660nm Protein Assay Reagent. Make a BSA standard curve as well to plot the absorbance into the concentration value.
reagents 
reagents

Storage
8. Add 5x SDS loading dye, boil at 95ºC for 3-5 min.
180s 
95temperature
9. Store at -20ºC until used.
ai_generated_description: This molecular biology protocol aims to extract protein from mouse aorta or vascular smooth muscle cell (VSMC) samples for Western blot analysis. The extracted protein is used to study molecular expression and interactions in the context of vascular biology and smooth muscle function.
